pricing_quick_reference.title: Approximate Pricing Guide (Simplify for quick quoting)
pricing_quick_reference.note: Always verify current pricing on Zoho website - this is for ballpark estimates

bundle_pricing_estimates.apps: CRM + Books + Desk + Projects + People + Inventory

pricing_objection_responses.seems_expensive: Compared to Salesforce at $75+/user, Zoho is 1/3 the cost. Compared to doing it manually, even one hour saved per day pays for itself.
pricing_objection_responses.why_not_free_forever: Free plans are great for testing. For serious business use, paid plans unlock features that drive ROI: automation, integrations, support, limits removed.
pricing_objection_responses.how_does_zoho_make_money_at_these_prices: Volume + efficiency. Millions of users globally, cloud infrastructure, no bloated sales org (unlike competitors). Savings passed to customers.

vs_salesforce.zoho_advantage: 1/3 the cost, easier setup (days vs months), better for SMBs
vs_salesforce.when_salesforce_wins: Enterprise with unlimited budget and complex customization needs

vs_hubspot_crm.zoho_advantage: No contact limits, more features included, better value
vs_hubspot_crm.when_hubspot_wins: Heavily marketing-focused companies already using HubSpot Marketing

vs_pipedrive.zoho_advantage: Broader features beyond sales, deeper customization, better ecosystem
vs_pipedrive.when_pipedrive_wins: Simple sales tracking only, nothing else needed

vs_excel_sheets.zoho_advantage: Automated, accessible anywhere, multi-user, no data loss, built-in analytics

vs_quickbooks.zoho_advantage: Lower cost, better inventory, seamless CRM integration, GST-compliant (India)

vs_tally.zoho_advantage: Cloud-based, modern UI, mobile access, auto-updates, no year-end migration
vs_tally.when_tally_wins: Local GST practitioner already Tally expert, offline-only needs

vs_xero.zoho_advantage: More affordable, includes inventory, part of broader business suite
vs_xero.when_xero_wins: Australia/NZ market with deep Xero integrations

vs_zendesk.zoho_advantage: 1/2 the cost, more features in base tiers
vs_zendesk.when_zendesk_wins: Complex enterprise support needs, already Zendesk-trained team

vs_freshdesk.zoho_advantage: Similar features, better Zoho ecosystem integration, customization

vs_shared_gmail.zoho_advantage: Organized tickets vs email chaos, metrics, SLAs, multi-agent coordination

industry_fit_quick_guide.title: Is this industry a good fit for Zoho?

common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.why_bad: Customer doesn't care about features if they don't see the problem
common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.do_instead: Ask discovery questions, uncover pain, THEN show solution

common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Recommending too many apps at once
common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.do_instead: Start with 1-3 core apps solving biggest pain, expand later

common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.why_bad: Customer sees it as expense, not investment
common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.do_instead: Calculate time saved, revenue gained, costs avoided - show the math
Show cost of Excel (time wasted, errors, scalability limits, opportunity cost)

common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.why_bad: Customer fears disruption and change management
common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.do_instead: Address implementation timeline, training, and support proactively

common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.why_bad: Most deals close after multiple touches
common_sales_mistakes_to_avoid.do_instead: Structured follow-up schedule, add value each time
Qualify decision-making process early, get to the real buyer

before_you_close: ✅ Identified all decision makers and influencers
✅ Understood their buying process and timeline
✅ Quantified their pain and our solution's ROI
✅ Demonstrated product and gotten positive feedback
✅ Provided references or case studies from similar companies
closing_signals_to_watch_for: Customer asking about training and support
Customer asking detailed questions about specific features
Customer wants to show it to team/boss (positive)
Customer asking about contract terms and payment
Customer comparing your solution vs competitor details

closing_techniques.assumptive_close: So let's get you started - when would you like to schedule the implementation kickoff?
closing_techniques.alternative_close: Would you prefer to start with just CRM, or CRM + Books together?
closing_techniques.urgency_close: We have implementation slots available next week. After that, it's 3-4 week wait. Want to lock in next week?
closing_techniques.roi_close: We've calculated you'll save $X per month. Each month you wait costs you $X. Ready to start saving?
closing_techniques.trial_close: On a scale of 1-10, how confident are you that this solves your problem? [If 7+: Great, let's move forward. If <7: What would get you to a 10?]
